well, time to wait forever for `dd` to copy this iso to this usb drive
<@U055JANKU>: I was talking about left_pad.py and that he said it was required to have a separate module for it or something along the lines of that.
2 minutes in with 57 MB copied, it’s a 4.4GB file
aaand now it’s dropped down to 200KB/s
I wish LinkedIn added a polite 'Who the fuck are you?' reply.
Haha yeah, I was offered a role of "IT Demand & Project Manager" last week. Apparently my profile fit perfect for the role! And I was like
/gif wat
My connections is exclusive
TIL: Use `dd` with /dev/rdiskN instead of /dev/diskN and get a free speedup
50 seconds in and it’s already over 100MB copied
much better
<@U053LEHJN>: OS X?
yeah
I’ve had that exact same problem
Super weird
<@U055JANKU>: it’s because /dev/diskN does buffering
rdisk is accessing the raw block device
doesn’t mean it should be so slow
why use dd to copy a file? o.O
<@U055JANKU>: it does when it buffers 4KB at a time
and is moving that buffer between userspace and back
<@U04TK850N>: writing an ISO to a usb drive
use disk utility then :smile:
It will probably optimzes the blocksize on the fly
<@U04TK850N>: since when can you use ISO's in OSX?
<@U04TK850N>: pretty sure I can't
I always converted them to img and then used `dd`.
uh, even then, just dd'ing a windows iso to a usb drive does not make it bootable?
<@U04TK850N>: sure does
must be new then
yeah, seems like that needs EFI and GPT booting. not new, but probably newer than the last time I created a usb installer on a non-windows pc :smile:
<@U04TK850N>: okay you’re right, turns out UEFI mobos won’t boot anything that isn’t partitioned FAT32
stupid Microsoft
hm
currently rsyncing the iso over to my linux machine to do something that actually works
you can normally just format the drive, set the partition as active and bootable, then copy all the iso content to the stick
yeah

on windows I use `diskpart`.

```
lis dis
sel dis <id>
cle
cre par pri
sel par 0
for fs=ntfs quick override
act
ass
```
abbreviated command work, so i just remember them :smile:
oh c'mon
can’t make my usb fat32 because “device or resource busy"
oh, forgot `ass` to assign a drive letter :smile:
